info.description: The Oracle Big Data Cloud (BDC) provides APIs to control Spark Jobs. Currently the following Spark Jobs are supported [batch,interactive,streaming] with the following Spark Sessions [spark,pyspark,sparkr].
info.title: REST API for Oracle Big Data Cloud
info.x-summary: The Oracle Big Data Cloud (BDC) provides APIs to control Spark Jobs.

parameters.description: Identity domain ID of the Oracle Cloud Service instance, used for authentication.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: Identifier for the Cluster

parameters.name: JobQueueRequest
parameters.description: List of Queue Definition that will be set on the Cluster's Job Scheduler.

400.description: List of errors related to the request.

404.description: The Job Scheduler Queues was not found.

name.description: The name of the interface. e.g. Spark UI

uris.description: The URI of the linked resource

type.description: The media type to apply to the URI

limit.description: For an integer value n, limits the number of results to n.

offset.description: The page number. Normally used if you are not specifying a marker or endMarker.

marker.description: For a string value, x, returns container names that are greater than the marker value.

endMarker.description: For a string value, x, returns container names that are less than the marker value.

prefix.description: Named items in the response begin with this value.

hasMore.description: Are there more items to fetch

queues.description: List of Queues that will be set in the Job Scheduler.

value.description: Value of the key stored in the keystore.

id.description: The id of the interface. e.g. 1

uri.description: The URI of the linked resource

name.description: Name of the Job, used for visual identification. It is not unique.

applicationType.description: The kind of application that this job represents.

applicationTags.description: A collection of tags or labels associated with this job.

queue.description: Job Queue where this job was scheduled to run.

intervalToPoll.description: Specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before rechecking the status of a job.

completedPercentage.description: A value between 0 and 100 that specifies the percentage that the job is complete.

startTimeMillis.description: Time in which job started (in ms since epoch)

endTimeMillis.description: Time in which job ended (in ms since epoch)

elapsedTime.description: Time since the job started (in ms)

allocatedMB.description: Sum of memory in MB allocated to the job's running containers.

allocatedVCores.description: Sum of virtual cores allocated to the job's running containers.

runningContainers.description: Number of containers currently running for the job.

message.description: Human-readable message that describes the current processing status.

error.description: Specifies the exception detail of the original request. This value is available only when a job has completed and failed.

memorySeconds.description: The amount of memory the job has allocated

vcoreSeconds.description: The amount of CPU resources the job has allocated

containerLogs.description: Location of log file(s) for a running job.

aggregatedLogs.description: Aggregated log file(s) for a completed job available in the cluster.

aggregatedStoredLogs.description: Location of the aggregated log file(s) that have been copied to long term storage.

connectors.description: Connecting interfaces that this Job offers. An example of this connector will be the Spark UI.

startTime.description: Specifies the time at which the job started.

endTime.description: Specifies the time at which the job has ended. This property is available only after a job has ended.

allocatedOCores.description: Sum of virtual cores allocated to the job???s running containers.

completed.description: Specifies whether the job has been completed. It can be used to determine whether the client needs to keep polling the -progress- status.

limit.description: limit that was set by the user

totalResults.description: Total number of items independent of limit

hasMore.description: Are there more items to fetch

clusterId.description: The Cluster where the given Job is assigned to run.

queue.description: Server queue used to submit too.

applicationName.description: The name given to the application, mainly used for UI or Audit Logs.

applicationFile.description: The name of the file, script, or jar file that will be used to submit the Job.

applicationSupportFiles.description: List of files that will be downloaded and collocated for the given Job.

maxJobDurationInSecs.description: Maximum duration of a Job in seconds. When a Job exceeds the amount of time the Job will be terminated.

maxSubmissionLatencyInSecs.description: The maximum waiting period that the requester is willing to wait for the job to actually start running inside a cluster before the Job is considered failed, REQUEST_TIMEOUT.

applicationArguments.description: Arguments that need to be sent to the _Application Main_ or the _Application Script_.

applicationJarFiles.description: List of jars that will be downloaded and added to the classpath of the given Job.

hadoopConf.description: Map of Hadoop configuration options that will be used to submit the Job.

extraJavaOptions.description: A map of extra JVM options to pass to the mapper and reducer. For instance, GC settings or other logging.

env.description: Map of environment variable that should be available to the Job containers.

preemptionDisabled.description: Set to `true` if preemption is enabled.

containerName.description: Name container that has this file..

path.description: Path of the file as described by the Object Store or File System where it is located.

lastModifiedAt.description: Timestamp when the file was created

bytes.description: Size of the file as described by the Object Store or File System where it is located.

bareName.description: Bare name as described by the Object Store.

hash.description: The MD5 checksum value of the object content.

ociRef.description: OCI URI that can be used to reference this object using the OCI HDFS Driver

swift2dRef.description: Swift2D URI that can be used to reference this object with the Stocator Driver.

swiftRef.description: Swift URI that can be used to reference this object with the Hadoop Openstack Driver.

directory.description: True if this object represents a pseudo directory.
True if this object represents a pseudo directory.

value.description: Value of the key stored in the keystore.

rack.description: The rack location of this node.

state.description: State of the node - valid values are: NEW, RUNNING, UNHEALTHY, DECOMMISSIONED, LOST, REBOOTED.

nodeHostName.description: The host name of the node.

healthStatus.description: The health status of the node - Healthy or Unhealthy.

healthReport.description: Additional information on the health of this node.

lastHealthUpdate.description: The last time the node reported its health (in ms since epoch).

usedMemoryMB.description: The total amount of memory currently used on the node (in MB).

availMemoryMB.description: The total amount of memory currently available on the node (in MB).

usedVirtualCores.description: The total number of vCores currently used on the node.

availableVirtualCores.description: The total number of vCores available on the node.

numContainers.description: The total number of containers currently running on the node.

containerName.description: Name container that has this file..

bareName.description: Bare name as described by the Object Store.

path.description: Path of the file as described by the Object Store or File System where it is located.

lastModifiedAt.description: Timestamp when the file was created

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the file was created

bytes.description: Size of the file as described by the Object Store or File System where it is located.

hash.description: The MD5 checksum value of the object content.

ociRef.description: OCI URI that can be used to reference this object using the OCI HDFS Driver

swift2dRef.description: Swift2D URI that can be used to reference this object with the Stocator Driver.

swiftRef.description: Swift URI that can be used to reference this object with the Hadoop Openstack Driver.

directory.description: True if this object represents a pseudo directory.

createdOn.description: Time in milliseconds since Epoch of the creation fo the Cluster.

reservedVirtualCores.description: Reserved virtual cores in resource manager.

availableVirtualCores.description: Available virtual cores in resource manager.

allocatedVirtualCores.description: Allocated virtual cores in resource manager.

totalVirtualCores.description: Total Virtual Cores in resource manager.

workerNodes.description: Metrics of each Worker Node in the Cluster.

platform.description: List of packages and their versions that conform this cluster.

href.description: The URI of the linked resource

method.description: The method to apply to the URI

mediaType.description: The media type to apply to the URI

count.description: Number of objects in the container.

bytesUsed.description: Total bytes used in the container.

storageServerTime.description: Time as described by Object Store.

quotaBytes.description: Available bytes quota as described by the Object Store.

timestampMs.description: Timestamp, in milliseconds, of the measurement.

nodes.description: Metrics of each Worker Node in the Cluster.

limit.description: limit that was set by the user

totalResults.description: Total number of items independent of limit

hasMore.description: Are there more items to fetch

limit.description: limit that was set by the user

totalResults.description: Total number of items independent of limit

hasMore.description: Are there more items to fetch

sparkSessionType.description: Type of the Spark session used to run the Job.

applicationName.description: The name given to the application, mainly used for UI or Audit Logs.

applicationFile.description: The name of the file, script, or jar file that will be used to submit the Job.

packages.description:
Comma-separated list of maven coordinates of jars to include on the driver and executor classpaths. Will search the local maven repo, then maven central and any additional remote repository
The format for the coordinates should be `groupId:artifactId:version`.

excludePackages.description: Comma-separated list of groupId:artifactId, to exclude while resolving the dependencies provided in `packages`.

repositories.description: Comma-separated list of additional remote repositories to search for the maven coordinates given with `packages`.

clusterId.description: The Cluster where the given Job is assigned to run.

applicationClass.description: In case of an application that runs inside the JVM this will specify the qualified name of the Class that will be used to call Spark-Submit.

applicationArguments.description: Arguments that need to be sent to the _Application Main_ or the _Application Script_.

applicationJarFiles.description: List of jars that will be downloaded and collocated for the given Job.

applicationPyFiles.description: List of python files that will be downloaded and collocated for the given Job.

applicationSupportFiles.description: List of files that will be downloaded and collocated for the given Job.

applicationArchives.description: Archives to be uncompressed in the executor working directory (YARN mode only)

driverLibraryPath.description: Extra library path entries to pass to the driver.

driverMaxResults.description: Limit of total size of serialized results of all partitions for each Spark action (e.g. collect). Should be at least 1M, or 0 for unlimited. Jobs will be aborted if the total size is above this limit. Having a high limit may cause out-of-memory errors in driver (depends on spark.driver.memory and memory overhead of objects in JVM). Setting a proper limit can protect the driver from out-of-memory errors.

driverCores.description: Number of cores used by driver.

executorExtraClasspath.description: Extra classpath entries to prepend to the classpath of executors.This exists primarily for backwards-compatibility with older versions of Spark.Users typically should not need to set this option.

executorExtraLibraryPath.description: Set a special library path to use when launching executor JVM's.

extraJavaOptions.description: A map of extra JVM options to pass to executors and driver. For instance, GC settings or other logging. Note that it is illegal to set Spark properties or heap size settings with this option. Spark properties should be set using a SparkConf object or the spark-defaults.conf file used with the spark-submit script. Heap size settings can be set with spark.executor.memory.

executorEnv.description: Map of environment variable that should be available to the Executor process. For example, the maximum waiting period that the requester is willing to wait for the job to actually start running inside a cluster before the Job is considered failed, REQUEST_TIMEOUT.

executorCores.description: Number of cores used by executor.

sparkConf.description: Map of Spark configuration options that were used to submit the Job.

queue.description: Server queue used to submit too.

maxJobDurationInSecs.description: Maximum duration of a Job in seconds. When a Job exceeds the amount of time the Job will be terminated.

maxSubmissionLatencyInSecs.description: The maximum waiting period that the requester is willing to wait for the job to actually start running inside a cluster before the Job is considered failed, REQUEST_TIMEOUT.

containerId.description: Unique Identifier of the Container that is generating the Log.

files.description: Log files with path relative to the Container.
